All 30 NATO member countries have to vote yes for Sweden and Finland to be admitted, and I am hopeful that the seven still left to do so, will.

I look forward to continuing to defend democracy and support Ukraine with Sweden and Finland at our side.

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: This is personal for me, too. My father was born in what is now Ukraine before fleeing during WWII, and he later served in the navy flying patrol planes to search for Russian submarines. When I was personally sanctioned by Russia, it was a point of pride for me and my family.

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: I also represented the U.S. government on a trip to Helsinki, Finland in June. We discussed a number of issues, among them Finland‚Äôs potential NATO accession. I am glad that those discussions are becoming a reality.

Pennsylvania‚Äôs public servants make our community stronger, and they deserve our support in securing the benefits they earn in service.

(4/4)

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text:
Our bill would cut through the red tape, correcting the rules so that people become‚Äîand remain‚Äîeligible for the forgiveness they earned from the moment they complete their required service term, regardless of whether they change careers before their paperwork is complete.

(3/4)

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text:
Currently, if our teachers, nurses, law enforcement, and other public servants move to a different career after completing their required payments, but before bureaucrats complete their processes, they could be denied loan forgiveness.

(2/4)

tweet_text:

name: Chrissy Houlahan

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: We need aggressive action to combat the literacy crisis in our country, and as someone with a background in early childhood literacy, I‚Äôm proud to lead the charge. /7

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: And the implications stretch beyond education. Over $200 million in health care costs is linked to illiteracy each year: when individuals can‚Äôt understand their prescription bottle, how can we expect them to stay healthy? /6

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: Prior to serving in Congress, I was a chemistry teacher in north Philadelphia to 11th grade students. Chemistry is already a complicated subject, but it‚Äôs made all the more difficult if you are reading at a 3rd or 4th grade level, as many of my students were. /5

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: As we work to get kids safely back in school, one of our first priorities needs to be addressing any loss of learning, particularly around literacy. What people must remember is that without literacy, learning other subjects becomes nearly impossible. /4

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: For years, the data has been clear: "A student who can‚Äôt read on grade level by 3rd grade is four times less likely to graduate by age 19 than a child who does read proficiently by that time." /3 https://t.co/5Juotk9Bel

name: Chrissy Houlahan

name: Chrissy Houlahan

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: Born into slavery in 1840, Sgt. Carney escaped to Massachusetts when he was still a boy. When the Civil War broke out, he served in the 54th Massachusetts Infantry Regiment. There, his actions earned him a service member's highest distinction - the Medal of Honor. /2

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: This #BlackHistoryMonth, we pay tribute to the first Black Medal of Honor recipient - Sgt. William Carney. Earning his award for protecting the American flag in the Battle of Fort Wagner during the Civil War, he is among America's most selfless heroes. /1 https://t.co/yHLMzW09rn

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: An activist, she participated in marches, registered voters, wrote about the Civil Rights Movement, and in 1982 published her Pulitzer Prize & National Book Award winning novel, The Color Purple. Today, we honor her legacy. 5/5

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: After transferring to a university in NYC, she graduated college in 1965, and published her first short story just two years later. After marrying a Jewish man and moving to Alabama, they were both harassed and threatened because of their interracial marriage. /4

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: "I was ordered immediately to the back of the bus b/c a white woman complained. I had been writing poetry since I was 9, but I realized I would never have the luxury of only writing poetry. I would have to be politically active in order to achieve enough freedom to write at all."

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: Born this day in 1944, Walker was the daughter of a sharecropper in the Jim Crow South. Defying norms, her mother enrolled her in school. Years later, as valedictorian, she earned a scholarship to Spelman College in Atlanta. But her arrival wasn't welcomed by all. /2

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: As a former educator, I may have been the one in the front of the classroom, but it was my students who taught me a valuable lesson: they just want a fair shot to succeed. This #BlackHistoryMonth, I'm honoring novelist & activist Alice Walker, a testament to this lesson. /1

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: Douglass‚Äô mere presence put him at risk because he was (at this time) an escaped slave, not a freed man. Being caught could lead to severe physical punishment and a return to slavery, or death by lynch mob. In 1895, Douglass returned to West Chester to speak once again. /4

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: Also present was Dr. Edwin Fussell, founder of the Women‚Äôs Medical College of Philadelphia and son of Dr. Bartholomew Fussell, a Chester County native who was one of the greatest conductors of the Underground Railroad, aiding over 200 slaves to freedom. /3

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: Barred from hotel accommodations because he was Black, Douglass was housed by two Quaker sisters who ran a nearby school. At the meeting, he joined fellow abolitionist James Fulton Jr., founder of the East Fallowfield Township Anti-Slavery society. /2

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: As we continue to celebrate #BlackHistoryMonth and its roots in our own community, I'd like to honor the moment in time when known poet and abolitionist, Frederick Douglass, came to West Chester in June of 1844 for an anti-slavery meeting to sway public opinion. /1

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: Diseases do not respect borders. In order to avoid a future where the United States is once again ill-equipped to battle a highly transmittable virus, we need to invest more in organizations like CEPI and work productively with our allies starting today. 9/9

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: The Administration needs to reengage with the international community. We, as Americans, stand to gain a great deal from working with our global partners on everything from vaccine development to distribution to the study of zoonotic disease. /8

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: CEPI is at the forefront of the search for not only a vaccine but also signs of the inevitable next pandemic. They are focused on the science, w/ experts from across the globe on the cutting edge of pandemic response research to better prepare us for future viral outbreaks. /7

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: By joining CEPI, the United States would be taking a proactive step towards fortifying itself against viruses like COVID-19. /6

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: Unless we take decisive action to change our present and future course of action, we will again be faced with unnecessarily high death tolls and community spread when the next pandemic strikes. /5

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: This particular legislation, which I also helped pass through the HEROES Act in May, has ramifications beyond those of COVID-19. What has been painstakingly clear is that we, as a nation, were woefully unprepared for a pandemic of this proportion. /4

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: Thus far, the Administration has failed to meet this moment ‚Äì 5 months in and 150,000 American lives lost, and we are still without a national testing strategy or a global plan for large-scale vaccine production and equitable access around the world. /3

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: As we continue to face this global pandemic, it's critical that the United States actively engage w/ the international community, including the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI), to rapidly and safely develop, manufacture, & distribute a COVID-19 vaccine. /2

tweet_text: Our READ Act makes clear that we‚Äôre fighting to make sure every child learns how to read, and consequently, can find success in their education and livelihoods. 5/5

name: Chrissy Houlahan

name: Chrissy Houlahan
tweet_text: Over $200 million in health care costs is linked to illiteracy each year: when individuals can‚Äôt understand their prescription bottle, how can we expect them to stay healthy? /3

name: Chrissy Houlahan
